lib.util.datasets¶

  • lib.util.datasets.mouse_v1
class lib.util.datasets.core.TrajectoryDataset(data_config, trajectories=None, preprocess=True)¶

Base class for datasets of fixed-length trajectories.

__getitem__(idx)¶

Return a fixed length trajectory from either training or testing set depending on the current mode.

__init__(data_config, trajectories=None, preprocess=True)¶

Abstract dataset class for fixed-length trajectory datasets. When working with any new type of dataset, create a new subclass of this class.

Parameters:

  • data_config (dict) –

    A dictionary containing the following model attributes:
    • test_proportion: float (optional)

      Proportion of dataset to use for testing.

    • traj_len: int (optional)

      Length of trajectories in frames to use. Not used in this object but it is recommended to use this in the implementation of the subclass.

  • trajectories (np.array (optional)) – A numpy array of shape [num_trajectories, trajectory_length, feature_dim] containing the trajectories to use. If not provided, the dataset should be loaded from disk in the load_data method.

  • preprocess (bool (optional)) – Whether to preprocess the trajectories before returning them.

__len__()¶

Return the length of the dataset.

combine()¶

Combine the training and testing sets into a single dataset for embedding

static convert_to_trajectories(vid_dict, traj_len=61, sliding_window=1)¶

Utility function used to convert sequences of frames into fixed length trajectories with a sliding window.

Notes

  • The inputs to each of the currently supported models are fixed length trajectories. This method will take a window of size traj_len and slide it over each video, with respect to time, extracting a fixed length trajectory for each window. The window is moved by a step size of sliding_window. If you increase sliding_window, you will be sampling fewer trajectories from the video.

  • The front and back of the videos are padded with repeated frames.

  • By convention, each embedding or cluster assignment produced by a model is treated as corresponding to the frame in the middle of the window.

Parameters:

  • vid_dict (dict) – Dictionary where the keys are the video names and the values are np.array of shape [num_frames, feature_dim].

  • traj_len (int (optional)) – The length of each trajectory to extract from the video.

  • sliding_window (int (optional)) – The number of frames to slide the trajectory window by.

eval()¶

Set the dataset to evaluation mode.

load_data(data_config)¶

Load the dataset, this must be implemented in the subclass used for training the model. It must return a tensor of shape [num_trajectories, trajectory_length, feature_dim]

load_vid_dict(root_data_dir)¶

This will iterate through root_data_dir and load the data corresponding to each video into a dictionary with the key being the video name and the value being the data.

static load_video(path)¶

Load the video data from the given path. This must be implemented in the subclass since it depends on modality / format of the data

postprocess(trajectories)¶

No postprocessing by default, but can be implemented in the subclass

preprocess(trajectories)¶

No preprocessing by default, but can be implemented in the subclass

train()¶

Set the dataset to training mode.
